sentences: Ira Coleman (born April 29, 1956) is a French-American jazz bassist.

Educated at the Berklee College of Music, he appears on four albums by Paris-based pianist Laurent de Wilde and has worked with artists such as Dee Dee Bridgewater, Milt Jackson, Ulf Wakenius, John Esposito, Joanne Brackeen, Herbie Hancock, Sting, Tony Williams, Ayọ and Antonio Farao.
Keys to the City – Mulgrew Miller
1992: Live at the Blue Note – Franco Ambrosetti
Folklore: Live at the Village Vanguard – Vincent Herring
In from the Cold – Jonny King
Below the Bassline – Ernest Ranglin, with Idris Muhammad, Gary Mayone, Monty Alexander
Black Inside – Antonio Faraò, Jeff Tain Watts (ENJA Records)
This Is New – Dee Dee Bridgewater
J'ai Deux Amours – Dee Dee Bridgewater
